## Description {#details}

A simple EPC server implementation.

## Public Member Functions

### handleDisconnect() {#aae9a77420cb32624ef47463b05ac6cb6}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void llvm::orc::SimpleRemoteEPCServer::handleDisconnect (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/error">Error</a> Err)</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
Handle a disconnection from the underlying transport.

No further messages should be sent to handleMessage after this is called. Err may contain an <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/error">Error</a> value indicating unexpected disconnection. This allows clients to log such errors, but no attempt should be made at recovery (which should be handled inside the transport class, if it is supported at all).

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/executionengine/include/llvm/executionengine/orc/include/llvm/executionengine/orc/targetprocess/simpleremoteepcserver-h/#l00151">151</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/executionengine/include/llvm/executionengine/orc/include/llvm/executionengine/orc/targetprocess/simpleremoteepcserver-h">SimpleRemoteEPCServer.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/executionengine/lib/executionengine/orc/lib/executionengine/orc/targetprocess/simpleremoteepcserver-cpp/#l00121">121</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/executionengine/lib/executionengine/orc/lib/executionengine/orc/targetprocess/simpleremoteepcserver-cpp">SimpleRemoteEPCServer.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### handleMessage() {#a7cebd705ee395af11d16ce83bad8060e}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>Expected&lt; SimpleRemoteEPCTransportClient::HandleMessageAction &gt; llvm::orc::SimpleRemoteEPCServer::handleMessage (<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/orc/#a1448b52253eb43f8f07b7f5d94336a47">SimpleRemoteEPCOpcode</a> OpC, uint64&#95;t SeqNo, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/orc/executoraddr">ExecutorAddr</a> TagAddr, <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/orc/#a7b57ebab4d32c81530df07ac39a3b0ca">SimpleRemoteEPCArgBytesVector</a> ArgBytes)</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
Call to handle an incoming message.

Returns &#39;Disconnect&#39; if the message is a &#39;detach&#39; message from the remote otherwise returns &#39;Continue&#39;. If the server has moved to an error state, returns an error, which should be reported and treated as a &#39;Disconnect&#39;.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/executionengine/include/llvm/executionengine/orc/include/llvm/executionengine/orc/targetprocess/simpleremoteepcserver-h/#l00146">146</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/executionengine/include/llvm/executionengine/orc/include/llvm/executionengine/orc/targetprocess/simpleremoteepcserver-h">SimpleRemoteEPCServer.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/executionengine/lib/executionengine/orc/lib/executionengine/orc/targetprocess/simpleremoteepcserver-cpp/#l00062">62</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/executionengine/lib/executionengine/orc/lib/executionengine/orc/targetprocess/simpleremoteepcserver-cpp">SimpleRemoteEPCServer.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### sendMessage() {#abb5f1d3ca5f0bd6275bad25b1374f4d2}
